column3:
Annie was helping her little brother Max pick flowers from the garden. They wanted to put the flowers in a jar to put on the kitchen table. Mother's Day was the next day and their mother loved fresh flowers.
ewline
ewlineAfter they picked flowers and put them in a jar, Max asked Annie if they could have a snack. Annie took Max into the kitchen and got out an apple to slice up. They sat down at the table looking at the flowers and ate their apple slices. There was a window in the kitchen that let in sunlight.
ewline
ewline"Hey!" Max said, pointing at one of the roses in the jar. "There's something moving on that rose."
ewline
ewlineAnnie looked more closely at the flowers. "It's a ladybug," she said. "We need to take it back outside."
ewline
ewlineSuddenly the ladybug began flying around the kitchen. Max jumped up and ran around trying to catch it. At last he clapped his hands around it. "Careful!" said Annie.
ewline
ewlineMax walked outside and let the ladybug go.
column4: one: What did Max do with the ladybug after he caught it?
column5: He put it on the rose.
column6: He chased it around the kitchen.
column7: He let it eat some of the apple slices.
column9: multiple: How did the ladybug get inside the house?
column11: Max put the ladybug in the jar and brought it in the house.
column12: It was on one of the roses when Max and Annie brought them inside.
column13: Annie let it in through a window.
column14: multiple: Why were Max and Annie picking flowers?
column16: So that they could have a snack
column18: There was nothing else to do
column19: one: Where did Max and Annie put the flowers they had picked?
column21: They gave them to their mother
